title: World Environment Day | Ceiling fans are used almost everyday; their power consumption can be cut by half by switching to BLDC tech

content: A witness of the stampede outside a stadium in Bengaluru during the RCB's IPL victory celebration on Wednesday described the scene as "haunting" and "horrifying", especially after she saw "six lifeless victims" in a span of 10 minutes.

title: "Entire State Was Watching. We Are Very Sorry": DK Shivakumar On Stampede Deaths
content: Underlining that he can't express the pain that "we are suffering" over the deaths in a crowd crush outside a Bengaluru stadium as tens of thousands turned up to cheer RCB's win the IPL), said Karnataka Deputy Chief Minister DK Shivakumar.

title: 'Will Find Out If Tragedy Could Have Been Avoided': High Court On Stampede
content: Taking note of the stampede in Bengaluru during the celebrations of RCB's victory in the IPL, the Karnataka High Court has issued notice to the state government and sought a status report.

title: Video: CCTV Captures Indore Couple Before They Went Missing In Meghalaya
content: As the mystery surrounding the disappearance of an Indore couple in Meghalaya deepens, footage from a CCTV at a hotel where they were staying has emerged. The blurry video shows Raja Raghuvanshi and his newly-wedded wife Sonam

title: "Waited 4 Hours To File Case": 15-Year-Old Bengaluru Stampede Victim's Family
content: The family of Divyanshi, a 15-year-old girl who died in the stampede outside Chinnaswamy stadium, Bengaluru, on Wednesday evening, said they had to wait nearly four hours before an FIR could be filed.

title: NTPC Launches 6th Edition Of Girl Empowerment Mission

title: "Pak Issued A Frustrated Statement After Our Malaysia Visit": Salman Khurshid
content: Congress leader Salman Khurshid on Thursday said his patriotism for India and his party exists in equal measure, days after he slammed his critics, including his colleagues, over his remarks perceived to favour the Centre.

title: Accused Strangled By 2 Prisoners Inside Delhi Court's Lock-up
content: A man who was under trial was strangled by two prisoners inside the lock-up of the Saket District Court in Delhi over a past rivalry. The victim, Aman, was taken to the hospital but was declared dead.

title: Putin, Trump Discussed India-Pak Conflict During Phone Call: Kremlin Aide
content: The recent conflict between India and Pakistan was among the issues discussed during a phone call between Russian President Vladimir Putin and US President Donald Trump, according to a Kremlin aide.

title: World Bank Lifts Lending Freeze Over Uganda Anti-LGBTQ Law
content: The World Bank is lifting a freeze on lending to Uganda it put in place in response to a 2023 law criminalising homosexuality, after taking steps to counter discrimination, it said Wednesday.

title: Russia Bans British Council, Calls It 'Undesirable Organisation'
content: Russia on Thursday banned the British Council as an "undesirable organisation", as Moscow branded London the architect of global crisis and "instigator of wars".

title: Southwest Pacific Hit By Unprecedented Marine Heat Waves In 2024: United Nations
content: Unprecedented heat waves in the Southwest Pacific affected more than 10% of the global ocean surface in 2024, damaging coral reefs and putting the region's last remaining tropical glacier at risk of extinction, the UN's weather body said on Thursday.

title: Caste, Not Class, Will Be Counted In 2027 Population Census: Sources
content: Caste, and not class, will be taken into consideration during the exhaustive count of the population of the country that will be held in 2026-2027, sources said on Thursday.

title: Apple Loses Bid To Pause App Store Reform Order In Epic Games Case
content: Apple has failed to persuade a U.S. appeals court to pause key parts of a federal judge's order requiring the iPhone maker to immediately open its lucrative App Store to more competition.

title: Senior Police Officer Also Among Injured In Bengaluru Stampede, Hospitalised
content: A senior police officer was among the dozens of people who were injured in a stampede in Bengaluru on Wednesday.

title: Suzuki Motor Halts Swift Production Amid China's Rare Earth Curb: Sources
content: Suzuki Motor had suspended production of its Swift car due to China's rare earth restrictions, two sources familiar with the matter said, becoming the first Japanese automaker to be affected by the export curb.

title: 'Criminal negligence': FIR filed against RCB, event organisers over Bengaluru stampede
content: Bengaluru Police have filed an FIR against the RCB franchise, DNA Entertainment Networks, and the KSCA Administrative Committee following the tragic stampede on Wednesday that resulted in 11 fatalities. The FIR, registered at Cubbon Park Police Station, cites criminal negligence.

title: Drones, K9 units: Post-Pahalgam attack, a full-spectrum shield for Amarnath Yatra
content: Ahead of the Amarnath Yatra, the government is implementing heightened security measures, deploying 581 CAPF companies, jammers, drones, and K9 units. Scheduled from July 3 to August 9, the pilgrimage will see signal jammers used for convoy protection against IED threats. Security forces will be stationed along the Pahalgam and Baltal routes, utilizing ROPs, QATs, BDS, and advanced surveillance technologies.

title: Big boost for Make In India: Dassault ties up with Tata to build Rafale parts
content: Tata Advanced Systems will manufacture Rafale fighter aircraft fuselages in India, marking the first production of these components outside France. This collaboration with Dassault Aviation involves establishing an advanced manufacturing facility in Hyderabad.

title: 'Lives more important': WC-winning captain on RCB's celebrations, stampede
content: Kapil Dev expressed his sorrow over the tragic deaths of 11 fans during Royal Challengers Bengaluru's IPL victory celebrations, emphasizing that lives are more valuable than celebrations and urging better safety measures for future events. He also wished the Indian team success in their upcoming Test tour of England, highlighting the importance of teamwork.

title: How B'luru stampede became one of Indian cricket's worst fan disasters
content: Celebrations turned tragic in Bengaluru as a stampede at Chinnaswamy Stadium claimed 11 lives following RCB's IPL victory. Thousands gathered for a victory parade, overwhelming security near Gate 7. The Karnataka government has announced compensation for the victims' families and ordered an inquiry. Police officials had warned about the risks of holding the parade at short notice.

title: AI killing jobs: Google AI CEO Hassabis has a tip; If I were a student..
content: Google DeepMind CEO Demis Hassabis advises students to prioritize STEM subjects and embrace AI tools for future job market success. Speaking at SXSW London, he emphasized the importance of understanding mathematical and scientific fundamentals. Hassabis predicts AI will create valuable jobs for technically skilled individuals, urging students to gain hands-on experience with AI systems.

title: 'I'm done living': Techie jumps to death from 21st floor in Pune
content: In a tragic incident in Pune's Hinjawadi area, a 25-year-old IT professional, Abhilasha Bhausaheb Kothimbhire, ended her life by jumping from the 21st floor of a building. Arriving at the Crown Green Society early morning, she visited a friend before taking the extreme step. A suicide note revealed her despair and apologies to her parents and friends for her decision.

title: Watch: New footage of Ukraine's drone strike in Russia reveal devastation
content: Ukraine's Security Service (SBU) executed 'Operation Spider’s Web,' a covert drone strike deep inside Russia, reportedly damaging 41 warplanes across four air bases. President Zelenskyy hailed the 18-month operation as historic, claiming it hit 34% of Russia's strategic missile carriers. The SBU released video evidence of the FPV drone attacks, launched from hidden compartments in trucks near the airfields.

title: Tech layoffs: Google, Microsoft, Intel and other companies that cut jobs in 2025
content: The tech industry continues to face significant workforce reductions in 2025, with over 62,000 employees laid off across numerous companies. Major firms like Google, Microsoft, and Meta are implementing substantial job cuts due to economic uncertainty and the need to prioritize profitability. Companies are restructuring, streamlining operations, and focusing on core business areas, leading to widespread layoffs across various divisions.

title: Maoist leader with Rs 40 lakh bounty killed in encounter: Report
content: Following the recent death of CPI (Maoist) leader Nambala Keshav Rao, sources report another senior Maoist, Gautam alias Sudhakar, has been killed in an encounter in Chhattisgarh's Bijapur district. Sudhakar, a central committee member with a Rs 40 lakh bounty, was reportedly gunned down during an anti-Naxalite operation in the Indravati National Park area.

title: 'Pain': RCB announce Rs 10 lakh for each family of deceased, mourn stampede tragedy
content: Royal Challengers Bengaluru (RCB), the IPL 2025 champions, have pledged Rs 10 lakh each to the families of the 11 fans who tragically died in a stampede outside M. Chinnaswamy Stadium during victory celebrations. The incident occurred amidst massive crowds eager to see Virat Kohli and his teammates.

title: Greta Thunberg sails to Gaza with aid: Israel says 'we are prepared'
content: Greta Thunberg is sailing to Gaza with aid, prompting a strong response from Israel, which declared its preparedness to intercept the vessel. The Israeli military has threatened action to prevent the ship, carrying essential supplies, from reaching the war-torn enclave. This mission is part of the Freedom Flotilla Coalition's ongoing efforts to challenge the Israeli blockade and deliver humanitarian relief.

title: Will AI replace engineers? Sundar Pichai says: 'I expect we will...'
content: Sundar Pichai, Alphabet CEO, announced Google's plans to expand its engineering workforce through 2026, countering fears of AI-driven job losses. Pichai views AI as an accelerator, enhancing engineer productivity and enabling Google to pursue opportunities in areas like autonomous vehicles and YouTube's global expansion. This commitment signals a shift towards growth-focused investment in human capital.

title: ‘Her laptop is still on office table’: Bengaluru techie dream ends in grief
content: Devi, a devoted RCB fan from Tamil Nadu working in Bengaluru, eagerly sought permission to attend the team's victory parade. Despite missing online ticket availability, she optimistically headed to the stadium. Tragically, her friends received a call from the hospital, marking the last communication and leaving them with the heartbreaking task of informing her parents.

title: Harvard vs Trump : US blocks foreign students over national security concerns
content: In a controversial move, Trump has barred foreign students with Harvard-hosted visas, citing national security concerns. The order suspends new admissions and reviews existing visas, impacting over 10,000 students. Accusations include unreported disciplinary issues and ties to the Chinese government. This decision raises concerns about the future of international students in the U.S.

title: TMC MP Mahua Moitra marries former BJD MP Pinaki Misra in Germany
content: Trinamool Congress MP Mahua Moitra has reportedly married Biju Janata Dal leader Pinaki Misra in a private ceremony in Germany. The two-time Lok Sabha member from Krishnanagar, Moitra, has not yet issued a public statement regarding the wedding. Misra is a veteran parliamentarian from Odisha’s Puri and a senior advocate of the Supreme Court.

title: B'luru stampede case: HC issues notice to govt; next hearing June 10
content: Following the deadly stampede near M Chinnaswamy Stadium during Royal Challengers Bengaluru's IPL victory celebrations, the Karnataka High Court has registered a suo motu writ petition. The court acknowledged the Advocate General's status report and scheduled the next hearing for June 10.

title: IND Tour of ENG: Suryavanshi reveals plan for IPL, says 'next year, I will work on ... '
content: Vaibhav Suryavanshi, the 14-year-old batting prodigy, aims to elevate his performance for Rajasthan Royals in the upcoming IPL season. Fresh off a record-breaking debut where he smashed the fastest century by an Indian off 35 balls, Suryavanshi is determined to improve further. He also earned the IPL Super Striker award.

title: 100-million-year-old dinosaur eggs recovered in Jurassic America
content: Fossil discoveries in central Utah reveal a diverse ecosystem 100 million years ago, with at least six distinct types of dinosaur eggs found. These eggshells indicate multiple oviraptorosaur species coexisted, alongside ornithopods and crocodylomorphs. Analysis of the eggs provides insights into nesting behaviors, soil conditions, and the rich microhabitats that supported this ancient environment.

title: Happy Eid-ul-Adha 2025: Eid Mubarak images, wishes, quotes & WhatsApp status
content: Eid-ul-Adha 2025 approaches, a time for Muslims worldwide to celebrate the Festival of Sacrifice. People are seeking heartfelt images, wishes, messages, and quotes to share with loved ones on social media platforms. The festival emphasizes love, compassion, and togetherness, encouraging acts of kindness and generosity in remembrance of Prophet Ibrahim's devotion.

title: Is the ‘doomsday fish’ a real omen of disaster? Here's what scientists say
content: The giant oarfish, or Regalecus glesne, is known as the 'doomsday fish'. Coastal cultures believe it signals impending disasters. Sightings are linked to earthquakes and tsunamis. The 2011 Tohoku tsunami fueled this belief. Recent oarfish videos went viral, predicting earthquakes. However, scientific research finds no connection between oarfish and seismic activity. Biological factors and climate change may explain their appearances.

title: IND vs ENG: Ponting highlights challenge for captain Gill; says 'won't be easy'
content: Ricky Ponting suggests Shubman Gill, the new Indian Test captain, should consider batting at No. 4 in the upcoming England series to ease the pressure of leadership. Ponting acknowledges Gill's strong white-ball form but notes his Test batting needs refinement.

title: Bengaluru stampede aftermath: Scene strewn with footwear, bent railings
content: A deadly stampede near Chinnaswamy Stadium during RCB's IPL victory celebrations in Bengaluru resulted in 11 fatalities and 75 injuries. The tragedy occurred at Gate No. 7 amidst rumors of free tickets, exacerbated by rain and poor crowd management.

title: Who is Mahua Moitra’s husband Pinaki Misra? All about four-time MP from Puri
content: Trinamool Congress MP Mahua Moitra has reportedly married Biju Janata Dal leader Pinaki Misra in a private ceremony in Germany. Misra, a four-time Lok Sabha MP from Puri, Odisha, is also a Senior Advocate practicing in the Supreme Court. He first entered Parliament in 1996 and has served on key committees.

title: 'Lalu's son failed Class 9 yet he wants him to be Bihar's king': Prashant Kishor
content: "We need to learn from Lalu Prasad Yadav how to worry about children. Lalu ji's son did not pass the 9th class, but Lalu Yadav is so worried about his child that he still wants him to become the king of Bihar. When we say this, people say that we complain about him. No! We are praising Lalu Yadav," Kishor said while addressing a public gathering in Bihar's Saran on Wednesday.

title: Paan Singh Tomar’s granddaughter booked for assaulting junior engineer in Jhansi
content: Sapna Tomar, granddaughter of the infamous Paan Singh Tomar, has been booked for allegedly assaulting a junior power department engineer in Jhansi. The incident occurred when a team was installing smart meters at her grandfather's house, leading to a physical altercation. A video of the confrontation has surfaced, intensifying public interest due to her family's history.

title: Covid cases in India: Coronavirus cases cross 4,500; Kerala tops chart
content: India reports 4,866 active Covid-19 cases as of June 5, 2025, with Kerala, Delhi, and West Bengal leading the count. Fatalities highlight vulnerability among those with pre-existing conditions. Globally, China, Singapore, Taiwan, and the United States report the highest cases. Citizens are advised to stay vigilant and take necessary precautions.

title: Tears of joy: Kohli's mother gets emotional after RCB’s win; pictures go viral
content: After an 18-year wait, Virat Kohli finally clinched the IPL trophy as RCB successfully defended their total. Kohli's emotional celebration, shared with Anushka Sharma and fans, highlighted the victory. His sister, Bhawna Kohli, shared heartfelt messages and family photos, celebrating the long-awaited triumph and expressing pride, while remembering their father.

title: Are banks and stock market open or closed on June 6 & 7? Check what's open for Bakrid
content: Eid al-Adha is anticipated to be celebrated in India on June 7, potentially marking a public holiday with closures for schools, colleges, and government offices. Banks will observe closures on June 6 in Thiruvananthapuram and Kochi, with varied operations on June 7 across different cities. Stock markets (NSE & BSE) will remain open, while digital banking services will continue uninterrupted.

title: No Trump worries: Why UAE is a great destination for Indian students
content: In the US today, education policy has become a weapon of ideology. Entry is no longer based on merit but on whether your passport aligns with America’s current geopolitical mood. In such a scenario, a new contender has quietly risen: the United Arab Emirates.

title: Raincoat & bloodstain: Grim clue found as search for missing bride continues
content: Meghalaya Police discovered a stained 3XL raincoat near Sohra during the search for Sonam Raghuvanshi, whose husband, Raja, was found murdered. Forensic tests are underway to determine if the stains are blood and if the raincoat matches Sonam's.

title: IPL: Sehwag reacts on Kohli winning title; says 'Tendulkar's wait was longer'
content: Virender Sehwag drew parallels between Virat Kohli's IPL trophy wait and Sachin Tendulkar's World Cup pursuit. Kohli's Royal Challengers Bengaluru (RCB) won the IPL, with Kohli's significant contribution ending his 18-year wait. However, celebrations turned tragic as a stampede during the victory parade resulted in 11 deaths and 47 injuries, leaving Kohli and the team devastated.

title: 'RCB should be sued': India WC winner lambasts IPL franchise; B'luru stampede sparks criticism
content: Following Royal Challengers Bengaluru's IPL victory, a felicitation ceremony at Chinnaswamy Stadium turned tragic. A stampede outside the stadium resulted in 11 fatalities and several injuries, prompting strong criticism from former cricketer Madan Lal. He condemned the poor planning and crowd management, urging families of the deceased to sue RCB and the government.

title: Communal post case: Influencer Sharmistha gets bail by Calcutta HC
content: The Calcutta High Court granted interim bail to social media influencer Sharmishtha Panoli, arrested for allegedly hurting religious sentiments through an Instagram video. The court instructed the state to provide basic amenities to Panoli while in custody and restrained authorities from filing new FIRs on the same grounds.

title: 18-yr wait ends: Ponting reflects on Kohli's breakdown; says 'that’s what it means to win IPL'
content: Virat Kohli's emotional reaction after Royal Challengers Bengaluru won the IPL final shows the tournament's importance. Ricky Ponting highlights Kohli's long-awaited victory. Kohli compares the win to his love for Test cricket. He urges young players to respect the traditional format. Ponting supports Kohli's views on Test cricket. He acknowledges the significance of such moments in Kohli's career.

title: Murder inside court lockup: Inmate killed by two others; old animosity suspected
content: Aman, an inmate from Tihar jail number 8, was killed by two fellow prisoners, Jitender and Jaidev, inside the Saket court lockup on Thursday. The assault occurred after all three were brought to court for proceedings. The Delhi police reported that Jitender and Aman had a prior conflict stemming from an assault in 2024, where Aman allegedly attacked Jitender and his brother with a knife.

title: Putin strikes after warning Trump: 5 killed in Ukraine's Pryluky
content: Russian drone attacks struck Ukrainian cities. Pryluky faced an overnight attack, resulting in five deaths, including a child. Six others were wounded. Kharkiv was also hit, leaving seventeen injured, among them children and a pregnant woman. The attacks targeted residential areas. Peace talks between Ukraine and Russia occurred in Istanbul. Russia declined a ceasefire.

title: IND vs ENG: England announce squad for 1st Test; check who made the team
content: England have announced their 14-member squad for the first Test against India, scheduled for June 20, 2025, with Jamie Overton making a comeback. Overton replaces the injured Gus Atkinson, while Jacob Bethell's return adds depth to the batting lineup. Ben Stokes will lead the team, which includes experienced players like Joe Root and Zak Crawley, alongside young talents.

title: How ICE arrested record number of illegal immigrants in a single day?
content: ICE conducted its largest single-day operation, apprehending over 2,200 individuals, many from the Alternative to Detention program, following White House directives to increase enforcement. Lawyers reported ICE used mass text messages to lure ATD participants to early check-ins, resulting in arrests. An ICE spokesperson stated those arrested had final removal orders, a claim disputed by lawyers.

title: Vande Bharat trains for Kashmir: Check full schedule
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi will inaugurate the Udhampur-Srinagar-Baramulla Railway Link on June 6. The launch includes the Chenab and Anji Khad railway bridges. Two new Vande Bharat trains will also be flagged off. Regular Vande Bharat services to Kashmir will commence on June 7, 2025. These trains will initially run from Katra to Srinagar six days a week.

title: Israel recovers bodies of two hostages from Gaza - Judih Weinstein and Gad Haggai
content: Israeli forces announced the recovery of the bodies of Judih Weinstein, 70, and Gad Haggai, 72, hostages taken during the October 7 Hamas attack. The couple, from Kibbutz Nir Oz, were killed during the attack, their bodies found in Khan Younis. The October 7 attack resulted in approximately 1,200 deaths and 251 hostages.

title: B'luru Stampede: Krunal Pandya breaks silence, says victory parade 'meant to share joy'
content: A stampede outside Bengaluru's M. Chinnaswamy Stadium resulted in multiple fatalities during Royal Challengers Bengaluru's victory parade. The team had just won their first IPL title. Cricketer Krunal Pandya and Virat Kohli expressed their condolences. The parade was cut short. Initial reports suggest overcrowding and poor crowd control caused the tragedy.

title: Bengaluru stampede: Deputy CM DK Shivakumar breaks down; watch video
content: Karnataka Deputy CM DK Shivakumar, in tears, addressed the media following a stampede near Bengaluru's Chinnaswamy Stadium during RCB victory celebrations, resulting in 11 deaths and over 70 injuries. He apologized for the tragedy, acknowledging the government underestimated the crowd size.

title: 'Allu Arjun was arrested, why not Siddaramaiah and Shivakumar?' asks BJP's Sambit Patra
content: Following a stampede at Royal Challengers Bangalore's victory march in Bengaluru, which resulted in 11 deaths, the BJP has fiercely criticized the Congress-led Karnataka government. BJP spokesperson Sambit Patra held CM Siddaramaiah and Deputy CM DK Shivakumar responsible, demanding their resignation. Patra questioned the event's organization, crowd control, and continuation of celebrations amidst the tragedy, calling it a 'government-manufactured tragedy'.

content: the focus is on redraft formats in 10-team PPR leagues . the top 20 rookies are ranked, along with the rounds they should be targeted . it's never too early to start planning for the fantasy season . we are less than 100 days from opening night in Philly .

title: Putin, Trump discussed India-Pak conflict during call: Kremlin
content: seasoned journalists and passionate writers tirelessly sift through the vast tapestry of global events to bring you the latest news and diverse perspectives round the clock . we strive to keep you informed about the ever-evolving world, delivering a nuanced understanding of international affairs .

title: Dave Roberts jokingly gives Shohei Ohtani remote-controlled car for his daughter
content: Dave Roberts and his wife bought a pink remote-controlled electronic Porsche for Ohtani's daughter . the two often share jokes and that this gift is a "little bit of a joke" but a sincere one . "this is going to be your daughter's first car," he says .

title: Don't hesitate to get Harper and Chisholm back into lineups
content: fantasy baseball buzz file aims to provide fantasy managers with the intel they need as news breaks around MLB . fantasy managers return Bryce Harper to their lineups after missing five games due to being plunked in the elbow by a pitch .

title: Justis Huni: Fabio Wardley's home crowd won't scare me -- my house was shot up
content: justis Huni has bided his time for a fight he says will "change his life" if he beats Fabio Wardley (19-0-1, 17 KOs) the australian was a replacement for Jarrell Miller, stepping up on six weeks' notice . he has settled in blackpool in the northwest of England for training camp .

content: the TOI News Desk comprises a dedicated and tireless team of journalists who operate around the clock to deliver the most current and comprehensive news and updates to the readers of The Times of India worldwide . the team is at the forefront of gathering, verifying, and presenting breaking news, in-depth analysis, and insightful reports on a wide range of topics .

title: Expert picks for Thunder-Pacers
content: the Oklahoma City Thunder and Indiana Pacers are the last two teams left standing . the Pacers won the series in five games, four of which featured 30-plus point outings from NBA MVP Shai Gilgeous-Alexander . this is the Thunder's second finals appearance, and it would be their first as the Oklahoma city Thunder .

title: We pitched trade offers for three NFL stars
content: quarterback Kirk Cousins didn't show up to start of OTAs last week . the Dolphins' front office has made it clear it's looking to trade cornerback Jalen Ramsey . we asked four analysts and experts to craft realistic trade offers for all three players .

content: e-Paper The View From India Looking at World Affairs from the Indian perspective . the latest news is from the world of cinema and streaming . science writers take the jargon out of science and puts the fun in .
